Description:
V. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS Incumbent is expected to have bachelor’s degree or higher. Further Material Management education would be beneficial
Incumbent is expected to have 15+ years’ work experience in a similar work environment, i.e., material management in Hydrogen/HyCO/ large ASU/electronic gasses/LNG/Coal Gasification/chemical/petrochemical industries project; 5 years working experience with Air products is preferred.
Good track record as project material management in leading and managing all aspects of Hydrogen/HyCO/ large ASU/electronic gasses/LNG/Coal Gasification/chemical/petrochemical industries project
Incumbent should have demonstrated skills in strategic thinking, resource planning and development.
Incumbent is expected to have certain working knowledge of Air Products material management standard, specifications, and procedures, as well as a comprehensive understanding of Air Products safety procedures.
Strong influencing skills are required to effectively manage site staffs. A proven ability to clearly communicate material issues with partners, as well as strong ability to handle multiple demands and commitments is essential to successfully fulfill this role
Excellent command of oral and written English/Chinese
Willingness to travel and be based in remote location in China and Saudi and/or other countries.
Overseas experience is a must Advantages:Knowledge and experience of industrial gas projects such as Hydrogen/HyCO/ large ASU/electronic gasses/LNG/Coal Gasification/chemical/petrochemical industries project.
Knowledge and experience on EPC management.Job Details
